name: DISPLAY MEMORY AREA
description: Displays a portion or all of a single element from a memory area.
syntax: DISPLAY MEMORY AREA mem_area# start_val size_of_element offset_in_element col_row_loc #_chrs_to_prt #_lines_to_print

parameters.name: mem_area#
parameters.description: This is the memory area to display. This must resolve to a value of 1 through 4.

parameters.name: start_val
parameters.description: The starting character in the memory area. The first character is at position 1.

parameters.name: size_of_element
parameters.description: This is the total width in characters of a single element. This command will be displaying a part or all of a single element.

parameters.name: offset_in_element
parameters.description: Where do the characters to be displayed begin within the element. The first character position in each element is 1.

parameters.name: col_row_loc
parameters.description: The beginning column/row location separated with a comma. For example, if the beginning location is column 10, row 10 then this would be:\nAT 10,10

parameters.name: #_chrs_to_prt
parameters.description: How many characters do you want to print from the element.

parameters.name: #_lines_to_print
parameters.description: How many lines (elements) do you want to print. The program will start with the position specified in START and print the number of lines specified here.

comments: This is the equivalent of the TAS Professional 3.0 command Display Memory.
